revised_title: Observations with a Large Equatorial Telescope by William Lassell
tldr: In this letter, William Lassell shares his experiences using his large equatorial telescope and his observations of nebulae, the moon, and Saturn. He confirms the spiral character of some nebulae observed by Lord Rosse and describes the moon's details with unprecedented clarity. Lassell also mentions the rarity of observing Titan's passage onto Saturn's disk.
